types.html:
en avoir ras la casquette

  1. (informal) to be sick and tired (of), to be fed up to the back teeth (with) [with de ‘something’]
    Synonyms: en avoir marre, en avoir ras le bol
    J’en ai ras la casquette de t'entendre te plaindre. ― I’m sick and tired of hearing you complain.

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Note that the pronoun en is part of the expression, and is used regardless of the separate de-phrase.
trans: to be sick and tired , to be fed up to the back teeth  .mw-parser-output .object-usage-tag{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output .deprecated{color:olivedrab}

title: en avoir ras la casquette
